result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin A Blum was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Probation conditions to apply exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and compete follow up care/treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

No illegal drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users/dealers/houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school with part time employment.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statuts Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.

Fine of $2,400.00 plus all mandatory applicable costs, penalties, surcharges including $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge by the end of probation period. Bail to apply.  Any remaining balance to convert to civi judgment.
If revoked The Court ordered that all financial obligations to be paid through collection of sums by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(40(b) and as a conditino of Extended supervision.   Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgmentl.

timeConds.notes: Release privileges for work and treatment only for the first six months, no electronic monitoring; for the balance of time the defendant shall have work, treatment and electronic monitoring.  Electronic monitoring permitted only if adhering to rules during condition time-State objects to electronic monitoring. Good time allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin A Blum

Filed:
*  Sentencing materials on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Kevin A Blum in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Parties in receipt of WCS report, defendant in compliance at this time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM026615  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/21/2014

Defendant Kevin A Blum in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Kevin A Blum in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for bail/bond hearing.   Case before the court to address the violation report filed on 5-20-14.  Statements of the parties heard; bail increase ordered on yesterday stands.  Case remains set for Status conference on 6-16-14 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.

Defendant needs to post an additional $100.00, previously posted bail of $1,000.00 remains.

Defendant Kevin A Blum in court.  No appearance on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.

Matter before the court for violation report.  Defendant provided a copy of the report.  On court's own motion the court increases bail to $1100.00 with same conditions as previously ordered.  The Court to revisit this issue when defense counsel present.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin A Blum in court with Attorney Darryl E Smith.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter set for Scheduling conference.  Defense not in receipt of complete discovery at this time; state awaiting results of blood test.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin A Blum in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Randy Sitzberger for Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Report dated 4/15/14.

Defendant Kevin A Blum in court with attorney Mary P. Polenz.  Defendant Kevin A Blum in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.
